author: AETerry
title: Police Helicopter clone of Fire Helicopter
review:
I just saw that this is listed in the data base now and the first thing I'm drawn to as the set 4900  Fire Helicopter is on my desk still the huge similiarity in build between these two small sets. The only difference between them is the color scheme for bricks, the minifigure and the side accessory that attaches to the helicopter.

 

I wasn't impressed with the first 4900 Fire Helicopter, I doubt I'll be much more impressed with this set. Even if the value comes from being small and an impulse item.

author: Munching_on_Monsters
title: One of my fave promo sets
review:
As no one has written a review on this, Then I shall do the first one! :). Right now the review, well its a great set for a promo, usual style police figure which i like :), some good, useful parts like the windcreen and main rotor. Also has a redesigned rear rotor which is a nice new part.I really like the helis design too, doesnt look like a random cheap combo of parts :), also the windscreen pops off to get the figure in & out, and it has some nice features like the radio on the side and the camera. I have 5 of these so combined them with a few spare pieces and made a police transporter which looks pretty cool :)
Munching on Monsters

author: Odeinoichus
title: Generic Model, So-So Polybag.
review:
Set #30014 Police Helicopter: Another Police Helicopter from LEGO City in Polybag form, read on to see the pros and cons of this 2011 set and whether or not it’s worth tracking down.

Pros:

  • Model design is very cute and works quite well, it is such a good design it has been used previously in earlier City Polybag sets, however this one has been slightly improved upon.

  • Minifigure is a standard Police Officer helicopter pilot seen in numerous sets. Still great looking figure.

  • Price-Per-Piece ratio was great upon initial release.

Cons:

  • Model needs to be taken apart to place the figure inside and take it back out, cockpit design doesn’t include opening windshield.

Overall opinion

This is a case of, do I really need another Police set? The Minifigure isn’t unique, the model has a bit of an issue with how it’s built because of the way the cockpit is built. I’d say it’s a pretty good looking display piece, but for play it might not be the best representation of a Police Helicopter in this scale. I recommend this set to Polybag fans, for casual buyers if you didn’t get this back in 2011 it’s not worth tracking down.
